snippet: New fitness tests are in part a response to increasing concerns of senior F.B.I. officials about the toll on agents after the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001.
abstract: Internal memo reveals that FBI has mandated fitness test for its agents for first time in 16 years; memo from director James B Comey reveals concern for agency's image, as well as concerns that agents have had less time for personal fitness due to systemic changes in years following Sept 11 attacks.
lead_paragraph: New fitness tests are in part a response to increasing concerns of senior F.B.I. officials about the toll on agents after the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001.

headline.main: Battling Crime and Calories at F.B.I. (Fit Bureau of Investigation)
headline.print_headline: Battling Crime and Calories at F.B.I. (Fit Bureau of Investigation)
